question: The "Nguni Cattle" is an indigenous cattle breed of which region?
explanation: The Nguni cattle breed is a special indigenous cattle breed of Southern Africa. They are known for their fertility and resistance to diseases. It is the favourite breed among the local Bantu-speaking people of Southern Africa such as South Africa, Eswatini, Namibia, Zimbabwe, Botswana, and Angola. In 1975, King Sobhuza III of Eswatini lamented the disappearance of the Swazi Nguni cattle. As a result, Mkhaya Game Reserve got established in 1979 to save the Nguni cattle breed.
